item.title: Project 1
item.description: This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: 0. (Introduction) library(plyr) base1 <- baseball library(tidyverse) library(fivethirtyeight) library(cluster) library(plotly) base2 <- mlb_as_play_talent head(base1) ## id year stint team lg g ab r h X2b X3b hr rbi sb cs bb so ibb hbp ## 4 ansonca01 1871 1 RC1 25 120 29 39 11 3 0 16 6 2 2 1 NA NA ## 44 forceda01 1871 1 WS3 32 162 45 45 9 4 0 29 8 0 4 0 NA NA ## 68 mathebo01 1871 1 FW1 19 89 15 24 3 1 0 10 2 1 2 0 NA NA ## 99 startjo01 1871 1 NY2 33 161 35 58 5 1 1 34 4 2 3 0 NA NA ## sh sf gidp ## 4 NA NA NA ## 44 NA NA NA ## 68 NA NA NA ## 99 NA NA NA ## [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.

item.title: Project 2

For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. (Introduction) library(tidyverse) library(dplyr) library(vegan) library(sandwich) library(lmtest) library(plm) library(Momocs) library(plotROC) library(glmnet) set.
